item.title: My first blog
item.description: I will be writing about some stuff I like about python, although I’m doing this through Rstudio and Rmarkdown. I’d been taking a few courses that use python and r, and since then, my main goto programming language has been python, r, or bash. R is really nice in dealing with already structures data files, and I think is easier to work with when it comes to data analysis. But I think it’s easier to automate the analyses in python than in R (maybe I’m just more used to automating in python).

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Introduction This data I worked on is about cardiothoracic diseases. The data was taken from https://www.kaggle.com/sulianova/cardiovascular-disease-dataset/data. Below are some explanations of the variables in the dataset. “id” is the unique identifier of the patients, which I omitted in the analysis “age” is the age of the patients in days “gender” of 1 is female and 2 is male “height” is the height of the patients in cm “weight” is the weight of patients in kg “ap_hi” is the systolic blood pressure “ap_lo” is the diastolic blood pressure “cholesterol” of 1 is normal, 2 is above normal, and 3 is well-above normal “gluc” of 1 is normal, 2 is above normal, and 3 is well-above normal glucose level “smoke” is binary, value of 1 indicates that the patient smoked regularly (subjective) “alco” is binary, value of 1 indicates that the patient took alcohol regularly (subjective) “active” is binary, value of 1 indicates that the patient was active (subjective) “cardio” of 1 indicates diseased patient Reading in the dataset cardio = read.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Hosei Nakajima Contacts vyrms168@protonmail.com Education University of Texas at Austin BS Biology, Computational Biology Cedentials: Elements of Computing Experience Currently working in Can Cenk’s lab to analyze sequencing data. Skills R/ Rmarkdown python bash Efficiently looking stuff up Interests Programming in general Problem solving Data analysis Computational Biology Stocks Virtual reality Hobbies Table tennis Learning programming languages Video gaming Cooking
